title: NCC Introduction - Aims, Organization and Incentives
description: Comprehensive test on NCC history, aims, organization structure, training activities, and cadet incentives

questions.text: When was the NCC formally inaugurated in India?
questions.explanation: NCC was formally inaugurated on 15 July 1948, after the schools and colleges reopened after summer vacation.

questions.text: What is the motto of NCC?
questions.explanation: The motto of NCC is 'Unity and Discipline' which reflects the core values of the organization.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT one of the main aims of NCC?

options.b: To provide leadership in all walks of life
options.d: To motivate youth for Armed Forces careers

questions.explanation: While sportsmanship is encouraged, creating professional sports persons is not a main aim of NCC. The aims focus on character building, leadership, and motivating youth for national service.

questions.text: When was the Naval Wing of NCC raised?
questions.explanation: The Naval Wing of NCC was raised in July 1952, completing the representation of all three services in the Corps.

questions.text: How many Directorates does NCC have across India?
questions.explanation: There are 17 Directorates located in state capitals, headed by officers of Major General/Brigadier rank or equivalent.

questions.text: What is the current approximate enrolled strength of NCC cadets?
questions.explanation: NCC has an enrolled strength of more than 13 Lakh cadets comprising Senior and Junior divisions for college and school students.

questions.text: Which of these is a Centrally Organised Camp (COC) in NCC?
questions.explanation: Leadership Camps (Basic and Advance) are Centrally Organised Camps planned by HQ DG NCC for all-India participation.

questions.text: How many seats are reserved for NCC 'C' certificate holders at IMA per year?
questions.explanation: 64 seats per year are reserved at Indian Military Academy (IMA) for NCC 'C' certificate holders as officers.

questions.text: What is the duration of Annual Training Camps for senior division cadets?
questions.explanation: Annual Training Camps are of 12 days duration for senior boys/girls and 10 days for junior boys/girls.

questions.text: Which organization provides financial assistance to cadets in case of injuries during NCC activities?
questions.explanation: Cadet Welfare Society (CWS) provides financial assistance and relief to cadets for injuries during NCC activities.

questions.text: What percentage of vacancies in Air Force courses are reserved for NCC 'C' certificate holders?
questions.explanation: 10% vacancies in all Air Force courses are reserved for NCC 'C' certificate holders through Air Force SSB.

questions.text: Which training involves attachment with army/naval/air force units?
questions.explanation: Attachment Training is formal training organized by attachment with armed forces units or officer training academies.

questions.text: What is the main objective of Youth Exchange Programme (YEP)?

options.b: To interact with youths of friendly foreign countries

questions.explanation: YEP sends selected cadets to friendly foreign countries for 10-day visits to promote international understanding.

questions.text: Which of these states provides reservation in police department for NCC certificate holders?
questions.explanation: Jammu & Kashmir reserves 10% or one post (whichever higher) in non-gazetted police services for NCC 'C' certificate holders.

questions.text: What is the rank of the officer heading the DG NCC at headquarters?
questions.explanation: The NCC organization at headquarters is headed by an officer of Lieutenant General rank as Director General.

questions.text: Which training activity includes mountaineering, sailing, and trekking?
questions.explanation: Adventure Training includes activities like mountaineering, sailing, para sailing, rafting, trekking, and expeditions.

questions.text: What benefit do NCC cadets get for recruitment in ranks of armed forces?
questions.explanation: NCC cadets get 5-10% bonus marks for recruitment in ranks in Army, Navy and Air Force.

questions.text: Where are Associate NCC Officers (ANOs) trained?
questions.explanation: ANO training is conducted at Officers Training School, Kamptee and Women Officers Training School, Gwalior.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a type of NCC staff?
questions.explanation: NCC staff includes Regular officers, WTLOs, ANOs, GCIs, PI Staff, Civilian Gliding Instructors and Civilian Staff - but not regular university professors.

questions.text: What was the original name of the NCC before independence?
questions.explanation: During First World War, Britishers created University Corps as second line of defence, which later evolved into NCC.

questions.text: Which ministry administers the NCC organization?
questions.explanation: NCC is administered through Ministry of Defence, with Defence Secretary being overall in charge.

questions.text: What is the purpose of National Integration Camps (NIC)?

options.b: To promote secularism and national unity
options.c: To prepare for Republic Day Parade

questions.explanation: NICs instill spirit of secularism and united India by bringing together cadets from across the country.

questions.text: How many Group Headquarters does NCC have across India?
questions.explanation: There are 95 Group Headquarters in India that exercise control over a network of Army, Naval and Air Force units.

questions.text: Which certificate is required for getting direct entry to SSB interview for officer commission?
questions.explanation: 'C' Certificate holders get direct entry to SSB interviews without UPSC written exams for officer commissions.

questions.text: What activity is specifically mentioned for Remount & Veterinary units?
questions.explanation: Remount & Veterinary activities are primarily meant for horsemanship and riding training.
